levels.title: What is Software Development?
levels.description: Learn the basic concepts and lifecycle of software.

levels.title: Introduction to HTML
levels.description: Understand the structure of web pages with HTML.

levels.title: Basic HTML Tags
levels.description: Learn to use paragraphs, headings, and lists.

levels.title: Links and Images in HTML
levels.description: Embed links and images into your web pages.

levels.title: Introduction to CSS
levels.description: Discover how to style web pages with CSS.

levels.title: CSS Selectors
levels.description: Target specific HTML elements for styling.

levels.title: The CSS Box Model
levels.description: Understand margins, padding, borders, and content.

levels.title: CSS Colors and Backgrounds
levels.description: Apply colors and background images.

levels.title: Introduction to JavaScript
levels.description: Learn the basics of the web's most popular language.

levels.title: JavaScript Variables and Data Types
levels.description: Store and manage data using variables.

levels.title: JavaScript Operators
levels.description: Perform arithmetic and logical operations.

levels.title: Conditional Statements (If/Else)
levels.description: Make decisions in your code.

levels.title: JavaScript Functions
levels.description: Write reusable blocks of code.

levels.title: JavaScript Loops (For/While)
levels.description: Repeat actions efficiently.

levels.title: DOM Manipulation
levels.description: Interact with HTML elements using JavaScript.

levels.title: Handling Events in JavaScript
levels.description: Respond to user actions like clicks and keypresses.

levels.title: Introduction to Git
levels.description: Learn the basics of version control.

levels.title: Creating a Git Repository
levels.description: Initialize a new project with Git.

levels.title: Committing Changes in Git
levels.description: Save snapshots of your code.

levels.title: Introduction to GitHub
levels.description: Host your code repositories online.

levels.title: Pushing to GitHub
levels.description: Upload your local Git repository to GitHub.

levels.title: HTML Forms
levels.description: Create forms to collect user input.

levels.title: CSS Flexbox
levels.description: Learn the basics of the Flexbox layout model.

levels.title: CSS Grid
levels.description: Understand the fundamentals of CSS Grid layout.

levels.title: Responsive Design Principles
levels.description: Make websites that work on any device size.

levels.title: Media Queries in CSS
levels.description: Apply different styles for different devices.

levels.title: JavaScript Arrays
levels.description: Work with ordered lists of data.

levels.title: JavaScript Objects
levels.description: Work with collections of key-value pairs.

levels.title: ES6 Features: let and const
levels.description: Understand modern variable declarations.

levels.title: ES6 Arrow Functions
levels.description: Learn the modern syntax for writing functions.

levels.title: Debugging JavaScript
levels.description: Find and fix errors in your code.

levels.title: Browser Developer Tools
levels.description: Learn to use the built-in browser tools for debugging.

levels.title: What is an API?
levels.description: Understand how applications talk to each other.

levels.title: Introduction to JSON
levels.description: Learn the standard format for data exchange on the web.

levels.title: Fetching Data with Fetch API
levels.description: Make network requests to get data from APIs.

levels.title: Introduction to Node.js
levels.description: Learn how to run JavaScript on the server.

levels.title: Introduction to npm
levels.description: Use the Node Package Manager to handle dependencies.

levels.title: Setting up a Basic Web Server
levels.description: Create a simple server with Node.js.

levels.title: Semantic HTML
levels.description: Write more meaningful and accessible HTML.

levels.title: Advanced CSS Selectors
levels.description: Target elements with more precision.

levels.title: CSS Transitions
levels.description: Add simple animations to your elements.

levels.title: CSS Animations
levels.description: Create more complex, keyframed animations.

levels.title: JavaScript Array Methods (map, filter)
levels.description: Iterate over arrays more effectively.

levels.title: JavaScript 'this' Keyword
levels.description: Understand the context of 'this' in JavaScript.

levels.title: Asynchronous JavaScript: Promises
levels.description: Handle asynchronous operations with Promises.

levels.title: Asynchronous JavaScript: async/await
levels.description: Write cleaner asynchronous code.

levels.title: Git Branching
levels.description: Work on different features in parallel with branches.

levels.title: Git Merging
levels.description: Combine changes from different branches.

levels.title: Handling Merge Conflicts
levels.description: Resolve conflicts that arise during merges.

levels.title: Introduction to React
levels.description: Learn the basics of the React library.

levels.title: Understanding JSX
levels.description: Write HTML-like syntax in your JavaScript.

levels.title: Creating Your First React Component
levels.description: Build a reusable piece of UI.

levels.title: React Props
levels.description: Pass data down to child components.

levels.title: React State
levels.description: Manage component-specific data with useState.

levels.title: Handling Events in React
levels.description: Respond to user interactions in React components.

levels.title: Conditional Rendering in React
levels.description: Show or hide components based on state or props.

levels.title: Rendering Lists in React
levels.description: Display dynamic lists of data.

levels.title: Introduction to Terminal/Command Line
levels.description: Navigate your computer and run commands.

levels.title: Basic Terminal Commands
levels.description: Learn commands like ls, cd, and mkdir.

levels.title: CSS Variables
levels.description: Create reusable values in your stylesheets.

levels.title: JavaScript Modules
levels.description: Organize your code into separate files.

levels.title: Local Storage
levels.description: Persist data in the user's browser.

levels.title: Introduction to TypeScript
levels.description: Add static types to JavaScript.

levels.title: Basic Types in TypeScript
levels.description: Learn about string, number, and boolean types.

levels.title: Creating a Simple React App
levels.description: Bootstrap a new React project with Create React App or Vite.

levels.title: What is a Component Tree?
levels.description: Understand the hierarchy of components in React.

levels.description: Learn a popular framework for building Node.js servers.

levels.title: What are Frameworks vs Libraries?
levels.description: Understand the key differences.

levels.title: Web Accessibility (a11y) Basics
levels.description: Learn why and how to make websites accessible.

levels.description: Understand the importance and types of testing.

levels.title: Code Formatting with Prettier
levels.description: Automatically format your code for consistency.

levels.title: Linting with ESLint
levels.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

levels.description: Learn the protocol that powers the web.

levels.title: HTTP Request Methods
levels.description: Understand GET, POST, PUT, DELETE.

levels.title: HTTP Status Codes
levels.description: Learn the meaning of codes like 200, 404, and 500.

levels.description: Apply your HTML, CSS, and JS skills to a small project.

levels.title: Final Project: Personal Portfolio
levels.description: Create and deploy a simple portfolio website to showcase your skills.

levels.title: Advanced CSS Layouts
levels.description: Combine Flexbox and Grid for complex layouts.

levels.title: CSS Pseudo-elements and Pseudo-classes
levels.description: Style elements in special states or parts of elements.

levels.description: Understand JavaScript's object model.

levels.title: JavaScript Classes (ES6)
levels.description: Use the class syntax for object-oriented patterns.

levels.title: JavaScript Error Handling (try/catch)
levels.description: Gracefully handle runtime errors.

levels.title: JavaScript Regular Expressions
levels.description: Find and manipulate patterns in strings.

levels.title: The React Lifecycle
levels.description: Understand component mounting, updating, and unmounting.

levels.title: React useEffect Hook
levels.description: Handle side effects in functional components.

levels.description: Load data from an API when a component mounts.

levels.description: Create your own reusable hook logic.

levels.title: React Context API
levels.description: Manage global state without prop drilling.

levels.title: React useReducer Hook
levels.description: Manage complex state logic in React.

levels.description: Implement client-side routing in a React app.

levels.description: Use React Router to create different pages.

levels.description: Learn about Redux, Zustand, and others.

levels.description: Understand the core concepts of Redux.

levels.description: Create routes, handle requests, and send responses.

levels.description: Intercept and process requests in Express.

levels.title: Introduction to Databases
levels.description: Learn the difference between SQL and NoSQL.

levels.description: Query data from a relational database.

levels.description: Combine data from multiple tables.

levels.description: Learn the basics of document-based databases.

levels.title: Connecting a Node.js App to a Database

levels.title: Authentication vs. Authorization
levels.description: Understand the key difference between the two.

levels.title: Implementing Session-based Authentication
levels.description: Manage user sessions on the server.

levels.title: Password Hashing with bcrypt
levels.description: Securely store user passwords.

levels.title: Introduction to Unit Testing
levels.description: Test individual functions and components.

levels.title: Testing React Components with Jest & RTL
levels.description: Write unit tests for your React UI.

levels.title: Introduction to Integration Testing
levels.description: Test how multiple parts of your app work together.

levels.description: Understand how modern JavaScript projects are bundled.

levels.title: Introduction to Babel
levels.description: Transpile modern JavaScript for older browsers.

levels.title: TypeScript Interfaces and Types
levels.description: Define custom shapes for your data.

levels.title: TypeScript with React
levels.description: Build type-safe React applications.

levels.title: Performance Optimization: Code Splitting
levels.description: Load code on demand to improve initial load times.

levels.title: Performance Optimization: Memoization (useMemo)
levels.description: Optimize expensive calculations in React.

levels.description: Learn a popular React framework for production.

levels.title: Next.js Pages and Routing
levels.description: Understand the file-based routing system.

levels.description: Learn about getStaticProps and getServerSideProps.

levels.description: Build backend APIs within your Next.js app.

levels.description: Securely manage configuration and secrets.

levels.title: Introduction to CI/CD
levels.description: Automate your build, test, and deployment process.

levels.description: Create a simple CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions.

levels.description: Host a simple website on platforms like Netlify or Vercel.

levels.description: Learn the basics of deploying a backend application.

levels.description: Learn about the singleton design pattern.

levels.title: Design Patterns: Factory
levels.description: Learn about the factory design pattern.

levels.description: Learn the pros and cons of each.

levels.title: Data Structures: Stacks and Queues
levels.description: Understand these fundamental data structures.

levels.description: Understand Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.

levels.description: Learn an alternative to merging branches.

levels.description: Understand the differences between the two API paradigms.

levels.description: Set up a simple GraphQL server.

levels.description: Enable real-time, two-way communication.

levels.title: Object-Relational Mapping (ORM)
levels.description: Interact with your database using objects.

levels.description: Learn a modern ORM for Node.js and TypeScript.

levels.description: Package your application into a container.

levels.description: Define the instructions for building a Docker image.

levels.description: Build the frontend for a simple e-commerce site.

levels.title: Intermediate Project: Blog API Backend
levels.description: Create the backend API for a multi-user blog platform.

levels.title: Final Project: Full-Stack MERN Application
levels.description: Build and deploy a complete MERN stack application.

levels.description: Break down a monolith into smaller, independent services.

levels.description: Learn how services find and communicate with each other.

levels.description: Create a single entry point for your microservices.

levels.description: Build systems based on asynchronous events.

levels.description: Learn to use message queues for inter-service communication.

levels.description: Orchestrate your containerized applications.

levels.description: Understand the core components of Kubernetes.

levels.description: Scale your database horizontally.

levels.description: Improve application performance with caching.

levels.title: Content Delivery Networks (CDN)
levels.description: Serve content faster to users around the world.

levels.description: Distribute traffic across multiple servers.

levels.title: Advanced Authentication: OAuth and OpenID Connect
levels.description: Implement third-party login.

levels.description: Understand the structure and security of JWTs.

levels.title: WebAssembly (WASM)
levels.description: Run high-performance code in the browser.

levels.description: Build web apps with native-like capabilities.

levels.description: Understand the trade-offs and implementation details.

levels.description: Learn the benefits and use cases for SSG.

levels.description: Write flexible and reusable typed code.

levels.description: Use tools like Prometheus and Grafana.

levels.description: Learn how to design systems that can handle growth.

levels.description: Learn about these non-linear data structures.

levels.description: Traverse and search through graph data structures.

levels.description: Learn how to build and maintain reliable systems.

levels.description: Learn a modern RPC framework from Google.

levels.description: Learn how to find a project and make your first contribution.

levels.description: Improve your ability to communicate technical concepts.

levels.description: Study different ways to structure large applications.

levels.description: Align your code with the business domain.

levels.description: Write tests before you write implementation code.

levels.description: Practice a system design interview with a peer.

levels.description: Learn to debug complex and elusive issues.
